page.title: 04GOYT VALLEY-RESERVOIRS
page.content: The first to be constructed was the Fernilee, at the northern lower end of the valley. It was built in 1938 by the Stockport Corporation Water Undertaking, under an Act of Parliament which also authorised a second reservoir(i.e. Erwood). It is the larger of the two, with a capacity of 1,087 million gallons, and cost Â£480,000 to build In 1964,planning approval was given for the second reservoir, Errwood to be built just upstream from Fernilee.Three and a half years and One and a half million pounds later, it was complete and filled to its capacity of 927 million gallons. .
